name: Chile-Garlic Shrimp
author: DadLuvs2Cook
summary: This is one of my favorite recipes that can be made as an appetizer of a main course. My wife and I have been making these delicious shrimp for a few years now and the entire family loves it.
ingredients: 1 pound uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
1 (1.6 oz) package buffalo wing seasoning mix (such as McCormick® Original Buffalo Wings Seasoning Mix)
¼ teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes
¼ cup coarsely chopped fresh cilantro
directions: Rinse the shrimp with cold water and pat dry with paper towls
Add the shrimp and seasoning mix to a plastic bag and shake to coat
Heat the butter, garlic, and red pepper flakes in a large skillet over medium heat until the butter has melted
Raise the heat to medium-high; when the butter begins to pop and sizzle add the shrimp to the pan
Cook and stir the shrimp until they are bright pink on the outside and the meat is no longer transparent in the center, about 4 to 5 minutes
Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the cilantro and lime juice
Garnish with lime wedges and serve hot
